title: Here's the Google Pixel 9a's exact release date
description: The Google Pixel 9a has long been rumored to arrive earlier in the year than its predecessors, with the launch said to happen around mid-March. Today a new leak gives us the exact release date, along with the date on which Google will start taking pre-orders for its next affordable Pixel smartphone. So, pre-orders will allegedly start on March 19, and the phone will start shipping on March 26 - which is also when it will become available in stores. excerpt: And also the date when pre-orders start. The Google Pixel 9a has long been rumored to arrive earlier in the year than its predecessors, with the launch...
text: The Google Pixel 9a has long been rumored to arrive earlier in the year than its predecessors, with the launch said to happen around mid-March. Today a new leak gives us the exact release date, along with the date on which Google will start taking pre-orders for its next affordable Pixel smartphone. So, pre-orders will allegedly start on March 19, and the phone will start shipping on March 26 - which is also when it will become available in stores. Google Pixel 9a leaked imageAs revealed a few days ago, the Pixel 9a will cost the same $499 as the Pixel 8a in the base version with 128GB of storage, but the 256GB model will see a $40 price hike taking it to $599. On top of that, Verizon's version with mmWave 5G support will command a $50 premium. The Pixel 9a is rumored to come with a 6.28-inch OLED screen with 2,700-nit peak brightness, the Tensor G4 SoC, 8GB of RAM, a 48 MP main camera, a 13 MP ultrawide, and a 5,100 mAh battery. It will be offered in four colorways: Obsidian, Porcelain, Iris, and Peony. Source
html:
The Google Pixel 9a has long been rumored to arrive earlier in the year than its predecessors, with the launch said to happen around mid-March. Today a new leak gives us the exact release date, along with the date on which Google will start taking pre-orders for its next affordable Pixel smartphone.

So, pre-orders will allegedly start on March 19, and the phone will start shipping on March 26 - which is also when it will become available in stores.

Google Pixel 9a leaked image

As revealed a few days ago, the Pixel 9a will cost the same $499 as the Pixel 8a in the base version with 128GB of storage, but the 256GB model will see a $40 price hike taking it to $599. On top of that, Verizon's version with mmWave 5G support will command a $50 premium.

The Pixel 9a is rumored to come with a 6.28-inch OLED screen with 2,700-nit peak brightness, the Tensor G4 SoC, 8GB of RAM, a 48 MP main camera, a 13 MP ultrawide, and a 5,100 mAh battery. It will be offered in four colorways: Obsidian, Porcelain, Iris, and Peony.

Source
